intro: Hibbertia pulchella, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Hibbertia pulchella is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds.
